channel.title: Comments on: The mysterious permission issue
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: shawn
item.dc:creator: shawn
item.description: Not only the share name is important but i've run into scenarios where after changing domains (and inspite of migrating all objects and permissions to the new domain successfully), the permissions wouldn't work (we're getting Access Denied). Our solution was to drop all permissions and rebuilding it on the share. Go figure!
item.content:encoded: Not only the share name is important but i’ve run into scenarios where after changing domains (and inspite of migrating all objects and permissions to the new domain successfully), the permissions wouldn’t work (we’re getting Access Denied). Our solution was to drop all permissions and rebuilding it on the share. Go figure!

item.title: By: Phil Hegedusich
item.dc:creator: Phil Hegedusich
item.description:
Administrative shares can be a PITA, that is.
As admins, we need to be careful about assuming that something will work just because it worked for us.
item.content:encoded:
Administrative shares can be a PITA, that is.

As admins, we need to be careful about assuming that something will work just because it worked for us.
